item.title: Olbers Paradox
item.description: Olber’s Paradox In the 19th century, many scientists at the time posed a rather simple question: why is the night sky dark? While today this paradox can be answered with our updated model of the universe, scientists at the time lacked evidence and certainty to choose from their handful of possible solutions. At the time , many scientists believed in a universe that’s static and infinite in space and time. This meant that there was an infinite amount of stars extending out forever.
